data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Bump version to 1.0.1

The version of all packages is set to 1.0.1 as some bugs are fixed, but no further changes were made.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Update README for jazzy

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp [Allied Vision]
data.message:
Pull request #62: Fix handling of missing features

Merge in HSW_SDK/vimbax_ros2_driver from bugfix/missing-features-not-handelt-correctly to dev

* commit 'd9897346a0963b5a6b1d121a693376eba3fe9b27':
  Fix handling of missing features

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Fix handling of missing features

Some legacy cameras like the Mako do not support all SFNC features. In the "camera_info_get" function these missing feature were not handled correctly and the function was always failing, if one feature could not be accessed. This is fixed by checking the return code for VmbErrorNotFound.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp [Allied Vision]
data.message:
Pull request #61: Feature/jazzy support

Merge in HSW_SDK/vimbax_ros2_driver from feature/jazzy-support to dev

* commit 'a45bf0998101aee26df9bbf15b6afbb0ef949a8f':
  Fixed coding style issues found with "colcon test"
  Replace rmw_qos_profile_services_default with rclcpp::ServicesQoS
  Replace _Float64 with double

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Fixed coding style issues found with "colcon test"

Fixed all coding style / syntax isses found by running "colcon test" with ROS2 Jazzy.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Replace rmw_qos_profile_services_default with rclcpp::ServicesQoS

The usage of rmw_qos_profile_services_default is deprecated in ROS2 Jazzy. So, it is replaced with the new equivalent rclcpp::ServicesQoS.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Replace _Float64 with double

When building the driver for ROS2 Jazzy on Ubuntu Noble (24.04) the build fails with varoius errors regarding _Float64 type. By replacing all _Float64 with double the issues are fixed and the build is running through.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Reworked disconnected / reconnect handling

- A camera must have been connected once, otherwise the discovery callback just returns.
- The reconnection is only handle, if currently no camera is connected (the camera shared pointer is null).

data.author: Hannah Hartmann [Allied Vision]

test_pixel_formats.py online editiert mit Bitbucket

adapted YCbCr422_8_CbYCrY pixel format

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Updated stream stop order to avoid error message

The frame processing thread is now stopped before the frames are flush and revoked to ensure, that no frames gets queued when it is already revoked.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Fixed packet size not adjusted after gige camera reconnect

The problem was that on reconnect the camera was opened in the feature invalidation callback and therefore it was not possible to access the adjust packet size features. This is fixed by starting a new thread which performs the camera open.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Adjusted node and tests to work with rmw_cyclonedds_cpp

- Adjusted  some tests, because with the new middleware images are often send out before the stream_start service has completed.
- The node contains a thread for the processing of each image to ensure that no image is send out after stop_stream has been called.
- The camera class now uses a stream state field instead of is_streaming. The field can have the values Stopped, Starting, Active and Stopping. The streaming field in the VimbaXCamera::Info structure is true if the stream state is starting or active and otherwise false.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Various changes for final deployment

- Moved VmbC headers to "include/VmbC" instead of "include/vmbc_interface" to fix dependencies errors of "VmbC.h".
-  Fixed crash during shutdown when the VmbC library could not be loaded.
- The "VMB_DIR" cmake variable is no longer added to the include path to avoid header conflicts.
- The system test are now only executed when the "VMB_DIR" variable is set.
- Added "launch_pytest" to package dependencies.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Fixed events test with real cameras

The events test was failing using real cameras due to changes in the vimbax_camera_events api. The test is now adjusted to match the api changes.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
The feature services now support accessing the features from all GenTL module not only the remote device module

In each feature service a feature_module field is added that specifies which GenTL module should be used. It uses an integer id with the following mapping:
  0 -> Remote Device
  1 -> System
  2 -> Interface
  3 -> Local Device
  4 -> Stream
If an invalid id is passed to any of the services the error VmbErrorBadParameter is returned.

data.author: Justus Braun
data.message: Flake8

data.author: Justus Braun
data.message: Timeout for service calls can now be set per call

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Fixed adjust packet size is not called automatically for GigE cameras

With the has_feature method it is now possible to check if a feature is present in a specific GenTL module. This extensions is necessary, because the auto adjust packet size feature is a stream not remote device feature and previously has_feature was only working for remote device features. In case of the auto adjust packet size it always returned false and therefore the packet size was never adjusted correctly. To support this functionality the camera class stores now the feature information for each GenTL module in a map.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Changed the return type in the subscribe event service from int32 to Error, reworked event api and examples

The subscribe_event function of c++ and python event api now return a future of the subscription handle instead of returning the subscription handle directly. With this changes now it is possible to pass errors (e.g. when the event is not supported by the camera) to the user. This was not possible with the old implementation. The examples are also adjusted to the new api and also handle the subscribe errors.
Additionally the c++ event viewer examples is now correctly installed and available in the debian package.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Added configuratable timeout to command feature run functionality

The timeout for command feature is added, because currently if a command feature does not complete or the waiting for is_done fails the application block infinitely.
This commit also contains a fixes a crash during camera reconnect handling.

Pull request #22: Feature/general improvements

Merge in HSW_SDK/vimbax_ros2_driver from feature/general_improvements to dev

* commit 'a601b6e428101522f95750bfecbc686e7a647720':
  Fixed format for some error messages
  Added check for existence of features GevDeviceIPAddress and GevDeviceMACAddress to prevent error messages in case the camera does not support these features.
  Fixed error messages in examples scripts
  Uncrustified
  Added has_feaure function to VimbaXCamera. Some features are not avaiable for all cameras so we now can check if a feature exists before executing a command e.g.
  Changed several RCLCPP_INFO messages to RCLCPP_DEBUG to clean up log output
  Improved error message texts

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Adjusted frame_id of image message

The frame_id field in the published image is not intended be the frame number of the received image but a constant value. In the header message definition the frame_id is defined as "Transform frame with which this data is associated".

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Fixed stream can not be started again after manual stop

data.author: Karsten Höpke
data.message: Merge branch 'bugfix/parallel-test-execution' into feature/general_improvements

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Fixed coding style errors

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Reworked automatic stream start

Instead of waiting for an graph change event, the node is check every 50 ms if the subscriber count of the image topic has changed and than starts or stops the streaming.

Pull request #15: Feature/UNISDK-3769 disconnect reconnect handler

Merge in HSW_SDK/vimbax_ros2_driver from feature/UNISDK-3769_disconnect_reconnect_handler to dev

* commit '3ae16330ef53596d81daf542bacfac9605030a53':
  Changed str_id type
  Switched camera_mutex_ to std::shared_mutex. Feature service access is now possible again via multiple callback threads. Improved synchronization of graph_notify lambda.
  Fixed var name
  Splitted initialize_services function into multiple functions to meet readability/fn_size linter requirement.
  Added mutex protection to event handler
  Changed some event feature names to SFNCFeatures struct.
  Added mutex to node dtr
  Fixed compiler warning
  Fixed failing camera tests
  Replaced std::atomic<bool> with std::atomic_bool
  Fixed reconnecting to wrong camera. Replaced unique_Lock with lock_guard.
  Added mutex for camera object protection. Fixed for cpplint errors.
  Removed unused request parameters from stream-stop_service, stream_start_service and features_list_get_service
  Fixed many cpplint + uncrustify errors
  First version of disconnect/reconnect handler. Stream is automatically restarted if it was running during disconnect.

data.message:
Pull request #12: Feature/UNISDK-3886 stream start stop service

Merge in HSW_SDK/vimbax_ros2_driver from feature/UNISDK-3886_stream_start_stop_service to dev

* commit 'dccd85936c11b6edb73bffa62fc45c1857426f43':
  Changed stream_stopped_by_service_  to std::atomic. Removed static for last_num_subscribers.
  Changed used stop_stream service function.
  Fixed cpplint and uncrustify errors
  Fixed handling for stream_start and stream_stop services. Since we do not get a notification for unsubscribing from the publisher via wait_for_graph_change we use a workaround by storing the number of subscribers. In case we re-subscribe to the publisher and the number of subscribers has increased we re-start the stream. Also introduced a ros parameter to disable autostart streaming.
  First changes for stream start stop services. WIP.

data.author: Karsten Höpke
data.message: Changed stream_stopped_by_service_  to std::atomic. Removed static for last_num_subscribers.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Added python event support library including examples and fixed test issues

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Added initial event and feature invalidation support

data.author: Karsten Höpke
data.message: Changed used stop_stream service function.

data.author: Karsten Höpke
data.message: Fixed cpplint and uncrustify errors

data.author: Karsten Höpke
data.message: Fixed handling for stream_start and stream_stop services. Since we do not get a notification for unsubscribing from the publisher via wait_for_graph_change we use a workaround by storing the number of subscribers. In case we re-subscribe to the publisher and the number of subscribers has increased we re-start the stream. Also introduced a ros parameter to disable autostart streaming.

data.author: Karsten Höpke [Allied Vision]

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Switch to multi thread executor

Previously simply rclcpp::spin was used to run the node. This is using a single threaded executor in the background. The single thread executor can only handle one service at the time and  if one service takes a bit longer to execute all other service are blocked. Therefore we now switched to a multi threaded executor which can handle multiple service request in parallel.

IP and MAC address are now send as string in the status service and the gige vision packet size adjustedment is now automatically executed when the camera is opened.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Added load / save settings unit tests and fixed timestamp calculation

The timestamp is now converted into nanoseconds by using the value from the local device feature "DeviceTimestampFrequency".

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Added of load / save settings functionality

The ros2 parameter "settings_file" can be used to load a settings file during startup. The service "~/settings/load" loads a given settings xml file into the camera and "~/settings/save" saves the current camera settings into the  given xml file path.
Also the parameter "buffer_count" is added, which holds the number of buffers used for streaming. It can be change using the standard parameter services, if the camera is not streaming.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp [Allied Vision]
data.message:

Merge in HSW_SDK/vimbax_ros2_driver from feature/UNISDK-3761-extend-node-with-streaming-capability to dev

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Fixed launch file syntax error

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Fixed crash when no camera can be opened

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Fixed frame not queued again when incomplete

If a frame was incomplete it was not queued again. This causes the stream to stop when too many frames were incomplete, because currently no frame is queued.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Added frame creation tests

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Added result class and refactored VimbaXCamera to use it

The result class is added to preserve the error code of the VmbC calls, if one fails.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Added streaming implementation and reworked logging

The vimbax_camera_node is now capable of streaming. The streaming is started automatically, when a subscriber is connected to the image topic (image_raw). It is also stopped again, when no node is subscribed. Added helpers to shift 10 and 12 bit formats left to be correctly aligned for the ROS 2 16 bit formats.
It is now possible to get the logger of the current node via the helper::get_logger method. By this all submodules log message are transmitted via the rosout topic.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Reworked VimbaXCamera open by id mechanism

When a camera id is passed to the open function of the VimbaXCamera class, it now checks first if a matching camera can be found in the camera list. If no camera could be found, it falls back to just calling VmbCameraOpen with the given camera id string. The behaviour eliminates that an error message is shown, if the serial number is used for opening the camera.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Added possibility to open the camera by serial number

To open a camera by serial number the VimbaXCamera lists all cameras and then searches in the list for the camera with the matching serial number.

data.author: Karsten Höpke
data.message: Added launch python file

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Call VmbCameraClose on deconstruction of VimbaXCamera class

The VimbaXCamera class now calls VmbCameraClose when it is deconstructed. It is also now long copyable, because the vmbc camera handle should not be shared.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Added camera open tests and fixed coding style

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Initial version of VimbaX Camera Node

Added initial version of the VimbaX Camera Node.
The vimbax_camera package builds now as a shared library and is loaded into the vimbax_camera_node by rclcpp_components.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Added TL search path to VmbC loading and added basic integration tests

During VmbC loading now also the TL search path used by VmbStartup can be specified.
Added basic integration tests for VmbC loading.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
VmbC API loader now automatically calls VmbStartup / VmbShutdown and reworked unit tests

The VmbCAPI class now automatically call VmbStartup, when it is loaded, and VmbShutdown, when it is destroyed. VmbCAPI behaves now like a singleton. When get_instance is called the first time the API is loaded and an instance of VmbCAPI is created. All later calls to get_instance will return the same instance independent of the argument libraryLoader. If all instance of VmbCAPI are destroyed, a call get_instance will create a new instance. The VmbCAPI class now also provides all functions of VmbC.
The unit test structure is now reworked and simplified. Also, a complete mock for the VmbC API is added, which can be later used for testing.

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Fixed api loader crash when environment variable GENICAM_GENTL64_PATH is n ot set

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message: Added cmake variable for specifying the VimbaX installation location

data.author: Dennis Langenkamp
data.message:
Added initial version of VimbaX C API loader.

The dynamic loading of the VmbC library currently only works for linux systems and also not all functions are loaded at the moment.
